definitions.definition: The process of childbearing; the beginning of life.

definitions.example: Intersex babies account for roughly one per cent of all births.

definitions.definition: A beginning or start; a point of origin.
The circumstances of one's background, ancestry, or upbringing.
definitions.example: He was of noble birth, but fortune had not favored him.

definitions.definition: To bear or give birth to (a child).
A familial relationship established by childbirth.
definitions.example: Her birth father left when she was a baby; she was raised by her mother and stepfather.
